intro: Fimbristylis brownii, commonly known as the Brown's sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in wet or marshy environments. The plant typically grows close to the ground, forming dense clumps that help stabilize soil in wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
